title: Date Plausibility — check_dp
text: dp_tbl tabular input || required primary input table contains descriptive information checks executed function. include definitions clinical fact types evaluated date plausibility. see ?dp_input_omop ?dp_input_pcornet examples input structure omop_or_pcornet string || defaults omop string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data visit_tbl tabular input || defaults cdm_tbl(visit_occurrence) table visit information, including identifiers can link back facts start & end dates. argument likely visit_occurrence table OMOP encounter table PCORnet. Custom tables specific visit subsets (.e. table nephrology specialist visits) can also provided. dob_tbl tabular input || defaults cdm_tbl('person') table patient identifiers can link back facts birth dates. argument likely person table OMOP demographic table PCORnet. death_tbl tabular input || defaults cdm_tbl('death') table patient identifiers can link back facts death dates. argument likely death table OMOP death table PCORnet. post_death_buffer integer || defaults 30 integer reflecting number days death function begin counting facts implausible. allows user capture autopsy results expected post-death facts occur within plausible window. check_string string || defaults dp abbreviated identifier used label output module

title: Facts Over Time — check_fot
text: function compute number rows, patients, (optionally) visits associated fact interest within specified time period. user supply end points time span (.e. January 2009 - January 2024) time period wish divide (.e. month, year).

title: Facts Over Time — check_fot
code: check_fot(   fot_tbl,   omop_or_pcornet = "omop",   compute_method = "loop",   time_span = list("2009-01-01", today()),   time_period = "month",   lookback_interval = 1,   check_string = "fot",   visits_only = FALSE,   distinct_visits = TRUE )

title: Facts Over Time — check_fot
text: fot_tbl tabular input || required primary input table contains descriptive information checks executed function. include definitions clinical fact types evaluated across user-specified time span per time period. see ?fot_input_omop ?fot_input_pcornet examples input structure omop_or_pcornet string || defaults omop string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data compute_method string || defaults loop string, either loop group, controls whether check executed looping time period grouping date field obtain counts. group recommended high performing database systems. time_span list (length 2) || defaults list('2009-01-01', today()) list contains start date end date total time period interest time_period string || defaults month string indicating length time period examined, like months years lookback_interval integer || defaults 1 integer indicating number time periods (defined time_period) look back interval. example, time_period month lookback_interval 3 produce quarterly counts. check_string string || defaults fot abbreviated identifier used label output module visits_only boolean || defaults FALSE set TRUE, function return visit counts return patient row counts. default, visit, row, patient counts returned. distinct_visits boolean || defaults TRUE set FALSE, function return patient row counts return visit counts. default, visit, row, patient counts returned.

Use cdm use pre-configured cdm_schema, result use preconfigured results_schema, input exact name schema. table_current name CDM pre-computed results table used retrieve counts associated current data model schema_prev REQUIRED PREV_CT_SRC = CDM; schema data reflecting previous data model version kept. Use cdm use pre-configured cdm_schema, result use preconfigured results_schema, input exact name schema. table_prev REQUIRED PREV_CT_SRC = CDM; name CDM pre-computed results table used retrieve counts associated previous data model filter_logic OPTIONAL logic applied table_current table_prev order tailor tables desired check assessment check_domain string indicating domain check (ex: drug_exposure, prescription_drugs) check_id short string "code" used identify specific check (ex: de, de_rx) check_description longer description check (ex: full drug_exposure table, prescribed drugs based drug_type_concept_id)

title: Domain Concordance Input File (OMOP) — dcon_input_omop
text: dataframe CSV file 10 columns cohort_id short string describing event row input file check_id short string "code" used identify specific check (ex: cancer_oncologists). always TWO rows check_id, row representing one two input cohorts. cohort_description longer description cohort (ex: cancer diagnoses, oncology specialist visits) schema schema data kept. Use cdm use pre-configured cdm_schema, result use preconfigured results_schema, input exact name schema. table name CDM pre-computed results table relevant data kept date_field date field used time_between_events null determine length time event occurrence concept_field *_concept_id field concepts make valueset (ex: condition_concept_id, drug_concept_id) conceptset_name OPTIONAL string name concept set identify concepts interest, appears predefined file_subdirectory filter_logic OPTIONAL logic applied provided table order tailor tables desired check assessment (ex: want assess prescription drugs) time_between_events OPTIONAL integer expressing maximum number days fall two events. Patients events occur far apart included combined cohort.

text: Intakes output check_dcon order apply additional processing. includes computing following cohort overlap counts proportions: cohort_1_only: overall, patients just cohort 1 cohort_2_only: overall, patients just cohort 2 combined: overall, patients 1 2 cohort_1_denom: patients cohort 1 cohort 2 cohort_2_denom: patients cohort 2 cohort 1 cohort_1_in_2: patients cohort 2 also 1 (use cohort 2 denominator) cohort_2_in_1: patients cohort 1 also 2 (use cohort 1 denominator)

title: Facts Over Time – Processing — process_fot
text: Intakes output check_fot order apply additional processing. includes applying heuristic meant compare fact count given time period time periods around . monthly computation, example, heuristic month / ((month-1 * .25) + (month+1 * .25) + (month-12 * .5)) value given month divided weighted average value previous month, next month, month previous year. function can also optionally compute ratio given total_pt column (added user) used denominator ratio_mult value used multiplier.

title: Facts Over Time – Processing — process_fot
text: fot_results tabular input || required tabular output check_fot. table include results institutions included computation overall / "network level" statistics. target_col string || defaults row_cts string indicating column fot_results used compute primary heuristic. ratio computation, row_pts always used regardless specified parameter. add_ratios boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicating whether incidence ratios / rates computed. TRUE, user edit fot_results table include additional total_pt column counts denominator user's choosing. recommend including desired denominator population check passed check_fot function facilitate computation patient counts time period. ratio_mult integer || defaults 10,000 add_ratios set  TRUE, parameter represent numerical multiplier used compute incidence ratio. result ratio represents fact rate per (ratio_mult) patients. rslt_source string || defaults remote string identifies location fot_results table. Acceptable values local - table stored dataframe local R environment csv - table stored CSV file remote - table stored remote database csv_rslt_path string || defaults NULL rslt_source set csv, parameter indicate path result file(s). Otherwise, parameter can left NULL

title: Facts Over Time – Processing — process_fot
text: function return list three dataframes: fot_heuristic: table summary heuristic  fact type (month / ((month-1) * .25 + (month+1) * .25 + (month-12)*.5)) fot_heuristic_summary: table summary values (mean, med, sd, q1, q3) based heuristic fot_ratios: fot_results table additional column incidence ratio (returned row_ratio = TRUE)

title: Facts Over Time – Processing — process_fot
code: # This function should be run after check_fot has been executed for all # network institutions and results have been combined into a common table  # Once the labels have been applied, the function can be executed ## When results are kept locally: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ my_fot_process <- process_fot(fot_results = my_fot_rslts,                               target_col = 'row_cts',                               rslt_source = 'local') } # }  ## When results are kept in CSV files: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ my_fot_process <- process_fot(fot_results = 'my_fot_rslts',                               target_col = 'row_cts',                               rslt_source = 'csv',                               csv_rslt_path = 'path/to/my/results') } # }  ## When results are kept on a remote database: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ my_fot_process <- process_fot(fot_results = 'my_fot_rslts',                               target_col = 'row_cts',                               rslt_source = 'remote') } # }  # You can also optionally compute patient incidence ratios. This computation will use # the patient count, regardless of what is specified in the `target_col` argument. # A column with the total patient count for that time period will need to be added to # the results output. It can reflect any patient cohort, so long as the column is called # `total_pt`. We recommend computing the denominator as part of the initial check_fot execution # and extracting the counts from the resulting output.  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ my_fot_process <- process_fot(fot_results = 'my_fot_rslts',                               target_col = 'row_cts',                               add_ratios = TRUE,                               ratio_mult = 10000,                               rslt_source = 'remote') } # }

what: Add summary columns for a large N of sites — summarize_large_n
title: Add summary columns for a large N of sites — summarize_large_n
text: analyses high volume sites output, standard, site-level results may difficult visualize plot. function compute high level summary statistics across sites provide another option visualization. also allow users compare site level output overall / "network-level" statistics.

title: Add summary columns for a large N of sites — summarize_large_n
code: summarize_large_n(   dq_output,   num_col,   grp_vars,   check_string,   time = FALSE,   shape = "wide" )

title: Add summary columns for a large N of sites — summarize_large_n
text: dq_output tabular output || required output tables created one check_* functions also passed associated process_* function num_col string || required string indicating name numeric column dq_output table basis summary statistic computation grp_vars string / vector || required string vector listing variables dq_output used grouping comparing summary statistics. check_string string || required string matches check string originally input analysis time boolean || defaults FALSE boolean indicating whether check time dependent. apply Facts Time output Unmapped Concepts output cases computed longitudinally shape string || defaults wide string, either long wide, indicating whether summary statistics separate columns table (wide) assigned separate rows name summary statistic site column (long)

title: Add summary columns for a large N of sites — summarize_large_n
text: function return original dq_output table addition summary statistics based numeric column provided. include: time = TRUE, mean median returned. time = FALSE, max, min, q1, q3, mean, median returned

title: Unmapped Concepts Input File (OMOP) — uc_input_omop
text: dataframe CSV file 8 columns check_id short string "code" used identify specific check (ex: de, de_rx) check_description longer description check (ex: full drug_exposure table, prescribed drugs based drug_type_concept_id) schema schema data kept. Use cdm use pre-configured cdm_schema, result use preconfigured results_schema, input exact name schema. table name CDM pre-computed results table relevant data kept concept_field *_concept_id field concepts make valueset (ex: drug_concept_id, drug_source_concept_id) source_value_field analyses produce_mapped_list == TRUE, *_source_value field linked concept_field interest used produce list source values associated unmapped concepts date_field analyses by_year == TRUE, date field used retrieve year associted unmapped concepts filter_logic OPTIONAL logic applied provided table order tailor tables desired check assessment (ex: want identify prescription drugs unmapped)
